intro: Cyrtandra calvicorolla, commonly known as the hairy cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
